page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content: The area includes three small villages, Chiselhampton, Toot Baldon and Marsh Baldon. The older houses are stone built and some still retain thatched roofs. More modern ones are brick (some rendered) and tiles. Most of the land is agricultural, some privately owned and some rented. Much of the area is owned by Queens College Oxford. As their properties become vacant they are being soldoff. The number of farm labourers has fallen and their homes are being bought and renovated by people working in nearby towns, Oxford and Abingdon. Some house holders commute daily to London by car (M40) or by train (Didcot). Some houses are only used at weekends. The number of children at the local school is low. There are no shops and no regular public transport so house- holders need a car.
